title: SSD
desc:
Sabrent 2TB Rocket NVMe 4.0 Gen4 PCIe M.2 Internal SSD Extreme Performance Solid State Drive (SB-ROCKET-NVMe4-2TB)

Power Management Support for APST / ASPM / L1.2.
Supports SMART and TRIM commands. Supports ONFi 2.3, ONFi 3.0, ONFi 3.2 and ONFi 4.0 interface.
Advanced Wear Leveling, Bad Block Management, Error Correction Code, and Over-Provision.
Upgradeable Firmware.

title: GEFORCE RTX 2080
desc: More CUDA cores, more Ray-Tracing units, more Tensor Cores as well as increased Base- and Boost Clocks: All of the above and more are on offer in the form of NVIDIA's new series of SUPER graphics cards, summoning forth even more power from the Turing architecture. The RTX SUPER graphics cards can, thanks to the increased number of CUDA Cores, offer even greater computational performance. Furthermore, thanks to the increased number of cores available, the cards have demonstrated their ability to perform at higher clock frequencies compared to standard non-SUPER models. Due to the added ray-tracing cores, users will benefit from the extra horsepower available for displaying realistic shadows and lighting effects. The increased number of Tensor cores on the other hand will bring improvements when it comes to the anti-aliasing of geometric objects.

title: Gaming Mouse
desc:
The latest Kone AIMO comes hard-wired with a very nice quality black braided cable. The cable is slim and light too, so it’s unlikely to drag while you’re gaming.
It’s easy to see that this is a Roccat mouse. It borrows many design elements from their existing range. However, it seems to have a bolder and more aggressive stance, and I certainly approve of that. Comfort isn’t compromised though, as the surfaces are smooth and curved where you want them to be, providing great ergonomics.
While the mouse does feature two large navigation button on the side, it also features a third button at the bottom. This thumb key is fantastic for additional macros and shortcuts; perfect for setting a melee attack in FPS games too. I have mine set as the Enter key, handy for progressing steps in my Photoshop macros.
